IID partition FedAvg(McMahan etÂ al. 2017) 97.07 86.35 89.32 64.15 25.27 72.43
FedDrop(Caldas etÂ al. 2018) 77.92 73.26 37.28 56.77 23.97 53.84

references:
TableÂ 1 shows the accuracy on the ShuffleNetV2 model with both IID and non-IID data, while TableÂ 2 shows the accuracy on the ResNet18 model.
Additionally, we provide a comparative analysis of communication overhead in the supplemental materials, assessed through the footprints of the transmitted models.
On both the ShuffleNetV2 and ResNet18 models, FedLPS outperforms the comparison frameworks in terms of average model accuracy. The superiority of FedLPS can be attributed to three reasons: firstly, the pre-trained shareable encoder is sophisticated to extract the low-level features and produce general embedding from the local data. Secondly, the task-specific predictors are pruned elaborately to satisfy the resource constraints, and the pruned predictors are trained on each task separately therefore suitable for performing the specific tasks. Thirdly, the heterogeneous predictor aggregation algorithm used in FedLPS leverages the knowledge in the backbone model to assist the aggregation of the local predictors, thus making the predictors learn from other clients better.

Additionally, we provide a comparative analysis of communication overhead in the supplemental materials, assessed through the footprints of the transmitted models.
On both the ShuffleNetV2 and ResNet18 models, FedLPS outperforms the comparison frameworks in terms of average model accuracy. The superiority of FedLPS can be attributed to three reasons: firstly, the pre-trained shareable encoder is sophisticated to extract the low-level features and produce general embedding from the local data. Secondly, the task-specific predictors are pruned elaborately to satisfy the resource constraints, and the pruned predictors are trained on each task separately therefore suitable for performing the specific tasks. Thirdly, the heterogeneous predictor aggregation algorithm used in FedLPS leverages the knowledge in the backbone model to assist the aggregation of the local predictors, thus making the predictors learn from other clients better.

In FedLPS, the larger the layer number nğ‘›n assigned to the shared encoder, the more training costs can be saved. In this experiment, we investigate the effect of the layer number nğ‘›n of the shared encoder on the training cost and model accuracy. The layer number nğ‘›n is set as âŒˆ0.25â€‹NâŒ‰0.25ğ‘\lceil 0.25N\rceil, âŒˆ0.5â€‹NâŒ‰0.5ğ‘\lceil 0.5N\rceil, and âŒˆ0.75â€‹NâŒ‰0.75ğ‘\lceil 0.75N\rceil, respectively. The floating-point operations (FLOPs) of the model are measured to indicate the training cost. In this experiment, the ResNet18 model containing 34.36M FLOPs is adopted.
Fig.Â 3 shows the model accuracy of MNIST, FashionMNIST, SVHN, CIFAR10, and CIFAR100 datasets while TableÂ 3 reports the FLOPs of the sum of the shared encoder and all task-specific predictors (before adaptive pruning). In FedLPS, the FLOPs linearly decrease as the layer number nğ‘›n increases, resulting in a substantial reduction in training costs.
Thus, FedLPS are more suitable for clients that are deployed with multiple tasks than existing FL frameworks as the training cost of multiple tasks can be easily reduced by building a shared encoder with nğ‘›n-layer.
Take the clients in ğ’1subscriptğ’1\mathcal{C}_{1} that deployed with 5 tasks as an example, in Fig.Â 3 and TableÂ 3, FedLPS achieves 86.27% and 81.08% of average accuracy with 21.3% fewer FLOPs (i.e., n=âŒˆ0.25â€‹NâŒ‰ğ‘›0.25ğ‘n=\lceil 0.25N\rceil) in the IID setting and non-IID setting, respectively. Whereas the SOTA frameworks only realize 84.31% and 79.70% of average accuracy (in TableÂ 2) with 171.8M FLOPs (5Ã—5\times FLOPs of the original ResNet18 model).

references: In FL, the communication overhead is predominantly influenced by the model footprint. Consequently, we present a comparative analysis of communication overhead in TableÂ 5 to evaluate the model footprints employed across various FL frameworks. It is noteworthy that, despite FedDrop achieving the utmost reduction in model footprint, it concurrently experiences the most substantial degradation in accuracy.
